google_play_reviews.content: This app is really good and secure. I like to use this app. But one thing is we are not able to password protect in the updated versions.
Used to be able to see the videos, now only shows a link to download them before watching. Fingerprint lock is gone. Older backups can't be restored with new version. It's a mess. 😥
Excellent

Excellent, especially the security. The possibility of backing up chats locally and restoring them is great. Edit: I am trying to restore a backup but there is no restore button. Furthermore if I try to back up, the backup feature only offers my contacts as the backup destination. This is stupid and frustrating. Why would I want to I want to send a backup file to one of my contacts? Removing 2 stars until this is fixed.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hello,

You can go to Settings -> Backup and Restore conversations -> Save the back up to a local folder which should show up in the apps that pop up when you try to save the file.If you are facing a specific issue then please raise a ticket and we will be happy to look into it - https://support.wire.com/hc/en-us

Thanks
Wire Customer Support

Love it

google_play_reviews.content: I've used this app since 2015. A simple text message takes quite a while after clicking resend a few times. Wish they would have just left it alone.

google_play_reviews.content: Great idea, mediocre execution. This app's cardinal sin is that it often doesn't notify that there is a new message. Furthermore, messages often do not go through without closing/reopening the app. And if a message doesn't go through there is no alert so you can re-send it. Lots of comical communication errors have occurred in my life resulting from this app's dysfunction. I love the idea and want it to work, but it's become very frustrating to use.

Frustrated... How can i uninstall this app?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Tap the icon and don't release your finger before a popup menu shows up. In the same moment, a trashcan icon should show near the top of the screen. Without releasing your finger, drag the app's icon to the trashcan.
If the trashcan does not show up, it might be bcs the icon is not on the main screen. Drag the icon to the main screen and try again.

While Wire seemed like a great messaging service with good security, it failed to do that... On the phone. The experience on desktop was far better, messages were on time, nothing was laggy or buggy as people describe here. Unfortunately however, when many people are trying to escape WhatsApp and the ever further reaching privacy policies of Facebook, Wire doesn't make the cut. The often too late messages or lack of notifications make it impossible to use it as a good replacement.

At first the app was okay. The most recent update has caused a few problems including no internet connection notification even though I do have it, delayed messages, and randomly dropped calls. I'll update if the issue is fixed.
